The E. purpurea plants which shown the best morphological properties (maximum height, dry and wet weight of leaves and roots, and leaf area) were selected for analysis of essential oil. Distilled water was added to 120 g powder samples (root, leaves, and flower head) at a 1:10 (g mL −1) ratio. The essential oil was extract based on the distillation procedure using a commercial Clevenger apparatus
27 .
